gw.api.util

Class SearchUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.SearchUtil

  • public class SearchUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides static methods for working with SearchPanels.

    NOTE: All methods in this class resolve the SearchPanel to work with by first attempting to find an ancestor of the widget that caused the event, and then by searching top down from the current screen.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void reset()
      Resets the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.
      static void resetResultOnly()
      Resets the result of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page. NOTE: The different between reset and resetReusltOnly is that the search criteria. For resetResultOnly, the search criteria is not reset. This is useful if the search criteria is supposed to trigger this reset. If you want the whole search panel to reset, then reset() is a better choice.
      static void search()
      Runs the search of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.
      static void search(com.guidewire.pl.web.navigation.Location location)
      Runs the search of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.

      • resetResultOnly

        void resetResultOnly()
        Resets the result of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page. NOTE: The different between reset and resetReusltOnly is that the search criteria. For resetResultOnly, the search criteria is not reset. This is useful if the search criteria is supposed to trigger this reset. If you want the whole search panel to reset, then reset() is a better choice.

      • search

        void search()
        Runs the search of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.

      • search

        void search(com.guidewire.pl.web.navigation.Location location)
        Runs the search of the nearest enclosing SearchPanel, or, if one cannot be found, the first SearchPanel found on the page.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to begin the search from.
